articles.title: "Are You Like This Dog...?" US Embassy's Student Visa Post Angers Chinese - NDTV
articles.description: The resumption of student visa applications at U.S. missions in China got off to an acrimonious start this week when netizens took exception to an American embassy social media post they interpreted as likening Chinese students to dogs.
articles.content:
A general view shows the buildings of the US Embassy in Beijing, China.
Beijing: The resumption of student visa applications at U.S. missions in China got off to an acrimonious start this week when … [+2037 chars]

articles.author: Elliot Smith
articles.title: Copper is ‘the new oil’ and low inventories could push it to $20,000 per ton, analysts say - CNBC
articles.description: The world risks "running out of copper" amid widening supply and demand deficits, according to Bank of America, and prices could hit $20,000 per metric ton by 2025.
articles.content:
A worker labels copper products at Truong Phu cable factory in northern Hai Duong province, outside Hanoi, Vietnam August 11, 2017.
The world risks "running out of copper" amid widening supply and d… [+3142 chars]

articles.title: Tencent said to be in talks with US to keep gaming investments - South China Morning Post
articles.description: Tencent, owner of the world’s largest gaming business, is negotiating with the Committee on Foreign Investment in the United States to retain its stakes in American game developers, said sources.

articles.author: Sporting News
articles.title: CBS commentator Beglin apologises for 'Latino temperament' jibe at PSG forward Di Maria following Man City ... - Goal.com
articles.description: The American star will make history if he appears in the final match against Manchester City on May 29.
